page.title: 15Top Of The Hill Farm
page.content: Top Of The Hill Farm is owned by Mr. Boothroyd, he gets up at 6:00 with his two sons to milk 37 cows.(The cows are milked four at a time) it takes one and a half hours to milk them all. About 70 gallons a day is sent to Dickinsons Creamery. Some of the milk is kept on the farm for the local authorities to come and test. The farm is inspected once a month to see it is disease free. Mr. Boothroyd bottles his own milk,he has three workers who deliver the milk to his 600 customers. Mr. Boothroyd has 58 cows in his herd the breeds are Friesian and Ayrshire. 37 are milkers and 21 are dry.Each cow gives about 5 gallons of milk a day which makes a total of 185 gallons a day. Mr. Boothroyd has 79 acres of land. The oldest building on the farm is 151 years old.
